text: The City of David (, Ir David), called in , Wadi Hilweh, is an archaeological site in Jerusalem. It is next to the south-eastern corner of the walls of the Old City of Jerusalem. The site is attributed to the palace of king David, and includes a water tunnel that was built by the king Hezekiah. Near the site live Jewish and Arabs. == Other websites == * City of David * From Shiloah to Silwan project * City of David, Biblical Archaeology Review Category:Neighbourhoods of Jerusalem Category:Archaeological sites in Israel
title: City of David
